intro: Monnina luteola, commonly known as yellow monnina, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often vibrant flowers. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a slightly wavy margin. Yellow monnina produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale yellow to reddish in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
